name: Bibimbap
desc: A vibrant and fresh Korean healthy dish! A bowl of rice topped with colorful fresh vegetables, meat, egg, and spicy-sweet Gochujang (chili paste), mixed well before eating. 🎨
content: Bibimbap, a dish that captures the colorful taste and nutrition of Korea in one bowl, is a feast for both the eyes and the palate! The fresh flavors of each ingredient blend perfectly with the deep richness of Gochujang. It's a must-try menu enjoyed by all ages! 🍚✨

name: Bulgogi
desc: Korean-style barbecue featuring tender beef or pork marinated in a sweet and savory soy sauce, grilled to perfection! 🥩 Full of smoky aroma. 🔥
content: Bulgogi, one of the most beloved Korean dishes by foreigners, delivers pure happiness with every bite as the sweet marinade seeps into the meat. Its flavor is doubled when eaten wrapped in fresh leafy greens. It’s the perfect hearty and delicious meal! 🌿😋

name: Kimchi
desc: A staple on Korean dining tables, this spicy and refreshing fermented cabbage or radish dish. 🌶️ It's also known as a superfood, a healthy side dish!
content: Kimchi, the soul food of Koreans and recognized worldwide, is more than just a side dish; it's the essence of Korean culinary culture. Its crunchy texture and spicy-sour taste pair well with any food, and it’s rich in probiotics, making it great for health. 💖

name: Samgyeopsal
desc: A representative Korean dining-out menu: thick pork belly sizzling on a grill, then wrapped in vegetables with Ssamjang (dipping sauce). 🥓 Even the sound is delicious!
content: Samgyeopsal, the most beloved dish by Koreans! When you wrap crispy, savory grilled pork belly in lettuce or perilla leaves with garlic, kimchi, and Ssamjang, it's a taste that washes away all stress. Perfect for enjoying with friends! 👯‍♀️🥂

name: Galbi
desc: Traditional Korean barbecue with marinated beef or pork ribs, grilled over charcoal! It's fun to chew every last bit off the bone. 🍖
content: Galbi has long been a special dish enjoyed at feasts or on special occasions. Grilled over charcoal for a subtle smoky flavor, it features tender meat and a perfect harmony of sweet and savory marinade. It's a representative menu that allows you to feel the warmth of Korean hospitality. 🎉

name: Japchae
desc: A celebratory dish made with various colorful vegetables, meat, and bouncy glass noodles stir-fried in a soy sauce seasoning. 🥳
content: Japchae, an essential dish for any feast, looks beautiful with its vibrant colors and offers a fantastic combination of sweet and savory flavors with chewy glass noodles. It tastes even better when eaten together with family. A dish that combines both health and taste! 🥢

name: Tteokbokki
desc: Spicy-sweet rice cakes and fish cakes simmered in Gochujang sauce. A representative Korean street food. 😋
content: Tteokbokki, loved by all Koreans for its appealing red visual and addictive taste that you can't stop eating once you start! You can enjoy it in various forms, from street food stalls in front of schools to upscale restaurants. Perfect for relieving stress while slurping it up with friends! 👯‍♀️🌶️

name: Sundae
desc: Korean blood sausage made by stuffing pork intestines with glass noodles, vegetables, and pig's blood. 🖤 It has a unique chewy texture.
content: Sundae is the essence of Korean street food, forming a fantastic combination often enjoyed with Tteokbokki. It’s interesting to discover the different types of Sundae and dipping sauces across regions. It boasts an excellent clean and savory taste! 🍽️

name: Gimbap
desc: A Korean-style roll made by wrapping rice and various ingredients in seaweed. 🍙 A nutritious and easy-to-enjoy meal!
content: Gimbap, always accompanying picnics and sports days! The nutty sesame oil-flavored rice and diverse fillings like ham, egg, spinach, and pickled radish are harmoniously blended, making it easy to pop into your mouth. It's also convenient to carry, making it perfect for outings. 🧺

name: Ramyeon
desc: A spicy and refreshing instant noodle dish with bouncy noodles, a Korean comfort food. 🍜
content: A bowl of Ramyeon that suddenly comes to mind late at night! It has captured the taste buds of people worldwide with its convenience (just add hot water) and spicy flavor that makes you sweat. You can add green onions, eggs, bean sprouts, and more to your liking for a richer experience. 😋

name: Kalguksu
desc: A traditional Korean noodle dish with chewy, hand-cut noodles served in a warm, rich broth. 🥣
content: Kalguksu, especially craved on rainy or cold days! It boasts an excellent cool and clean taste, simmered in various broths like chicken, clam, or anchovy. Enjoying the chewy noodles and generous toppings together will warm you up inside. ❤️‍🔥

name: Naengmyeon
desc: A representative Korean summer delicacy with refreshing, icy broth and chewy buckwheat noodles. ❄️
content: Naengmyeon, to cool off on hot summer days! It's topped with thinly sliced cucumber, radish, and meat in a sweet and sour broth. Choose between spicy Bibim Naengmyeon (mixed with sauce) or refreshing Mul Naengmyeon (in cold broth) to suit your preference! 🧊

name: Samgyetang
desc: A nourishing soup made by simmering a young chicken stuffed with glutinous rice, ginseng, and jujubes. 💪 It makes you feel strong!
content: Samgyetang, a representative Korean health food, is often enjoyed when feeling run down or on hot summer 'Boknal' (dog days). The tender chicken meat and rich broth, simmered for a long time, help restore your energy. A must-try if you're thinking of your health! 🌿🍗

name: Haemul Pajeon
desc: A Korean savory pancake generously loaded with fresh seafood and green onions, pan-fried until crispy. 🍤 Perfect with Makgeolli!
content: Haemul Pajeon tastes even better when sizzled on a rainy day! Various seafood like squid and shrimp add a delightful chewiness, and the crispy yet moist texture is superb. With a refreshing glass of Makgeolli (rice wine), it's a perfect combination! 🥂😋

name: Kimchi Jjigae
desc: A representative Korean stew, made by simmering well-fermented kimchi with pork and tofu until spicy and hearty. 🍲 A 'rice thief'!
content: Kimchi Jjigae, a Korean soul stew that you can eat every day without getting tired of it! The sourness of aged kimchi combined with the savoriness of pork creates a deep and spicy flavor. It’s a truly satisfying and filling meal when eaten with warm rice. 👍

name: Doenjang Jjigae
desc: A traditional Korean stew simmering savory soybean paste with tofu, vegetables, and seafood. 🥢
content: Doenjang Jjigae, standing shoulder to shoulder with Kimchi Jjigae on the Korean dining table! The deep flavor of homemade soybean paste and various ingredients come together, making you instinctively sigh 'Ah~' with just one spoonful. Experience the warmth of Korea with its comforting and savory taste. 🥰

name: Budae Jjigae
desc: A hearty and spicy fusion stew with ham, sausages, ramen noodles, and kimchi. 🌶️
content: Budae Jjigae, loved by all ages for its generous portion and spicy flavor! With various ingredients like ham, sausages, cheese, and ramen, it's fun to pick out different bits. It’s perfect for friends to gather around and enjoy a warm, bubbling pot. 🍜🥓

name: Seolleongtang
desc: A clean and savory beef bone broth dish, made by simmering ox bones until milky white, often eaten with rice. 🐄
content: Seolleongtang, a representative Korean health food, is known for its excellent rich broth made from ox bones simmered for a long time. When you mix rice and thin noodles into the milky broth and eat it with Kkakdugi (diced radish kimchi), it feels incredibly satisfying and comforting. 👍

name: Gamjatang
desc: A spicy stew with pork backbone, potatoes, and napa cabbage. 🥔 Great for hangovers too!
content: Gamjatang, with its spicy yet deep flavor, is perfect as a drinking snack or a hearty meal. The joy of stripping tender meat from the backbone, combined with fluffy potatoes and the spicy broth, is superb. Highly recommended as a hangover soup! 🍖🌶️
